title: “Evolutionary Creationists”—Twisting and Distorting the Scriptures
cleaned_text:
“Christians, Science, and Pandemic Times: Love Your Neighbor, Wear a Mask.” BioLogos, the so-called “evolutionary creationist” (really theistic evolutionist) organization, recently released this statement. In it, they included a twisting and misrepresentation of Scripture (not surprising, considering how BioLogos blatantly twists the words in Genesis and many other places!). Well, AiG’s Dr. Georgia Purdom recently appeared on Heidi St. John’s podcast, Off the Bench (many know Heidi as “The Busy Mom”), to discuss BioLogos and the dangers of this organization.

Christians need to know about groups like BioLogos that are infiltrating the church, Christian institutions, and Christian colleges and seminaries. They are twisting and distorting the Scriptures, claiming they believe the Bible and uphold biblical authority when they don’t. They reject a historical Genesis, deny the existence of a real Adam and Eve, and reinterpret God’s Word in light of man’s atheistic and naturalistic ideas. They also are very subtle about how they get into colleges, claiming to provide seminars on science and so on. But underneath it all is a planned attack to undermine the authority of God’s Word in Genesis.

This podcast episode is fascinating—Georgia does an excellent job passionately exposing this organization for what it is and pointing people to the truth of God’s Word. Don’t miss this important discussion titled “Jesus, BioLogos, and Vaccinations. What’s the Connection?” You can find this episode, and Heidi’s podcast Off the Bench, on Spotify, iTunes, Anchor, or on Heidi St. John’s website.

Thanks for stopping by and thanks for praying,

Ken

This item was written with the assistance of AiG’s research team.
